reviews.text: Although this hotel is old-fashioned and needs updating, there is NO excuse for the shoddy, careless was it is managed. It does indeed have a good infrastructure with a lovely outdoor pool and a good indoor pool and gym. However, they do not bother, for example, to put the beds / chairs out around the pool and you have to drag them around yourself. You then have to clean them as EVERY chair and bed by the pool was filthy. The whole area was dirty and you felt like you were relaxing in a parking lot with a swimming pool. The reception staff were friendly, but we soon discovered that their only concern was trying to get you to book a taxi for a tour and you could not trust their advice. The bar in the lobby was staffed the 4 days we were there by a rude young woman who was making it very obvious that our requests (for a beer!) were a huge inconvenience. Breakfast was a shambles. Dirty crockery every morning. Coffee was instant from little packets. We were unable to buy a bottle of water before noon (in a 4 star hotel!). On the Sabbath non-Jewish guests were completely ignored and absolutely no information was provided that the hotel would more or less close down. On Saturday morning the reception staff were eating in the back office and it was a fight to check out. On the plus side the rooms were spacious and clean and the men who cleaned the room were very helpful and polite. Avoid this hotel. We loved Jerusalem despite staying at this hotel but it was not a nice place to come back to at the end of the day. I hated it.

reviews.text: How could anyone not enjoy a stay at Leonardo Inn in Jerusalem. Big rooms that are cleaned everyday. Great breakfast and dinner and a very helpful and pleasant staff. Although the hotel lies in a rather busy and noisy neighbourhood - several large freeways closeby, its relatively quiet for a hotel of that size and location. It's furthermore very close to the light rail train(2-3 min walk) that will take you to the old city in 10-15 minutes and not only that - the route passes through the city in such a convenient way making taxis virtually redundant.
reviews.title: Splendid vacation

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are also very helpful when it comes to help with tours around the country - also there are taxis outside the hotel more or less all the time - and if not, the front desk will get one for you. The only downside is that there's no shops in the immediate vicinity, the closest are about 10 - 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Not thats its really a problem - the city is full of small shops and shopping malls.

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at the last weekend, It's not the first time we went there, I come to the hotel three times a year. Arriving there is easy, It's in the enterance to jerusalem. The crew is kind and generous - everything we needed - they gave us and quickly. The accommodation was excellent, everywhere we went in the hotel the crew was wonderful. The rooms are beutiful and spacious and also very well air conditioned. Customer service is efficient, there's always someone to talk to. The food is excellent compared to a four star hotel and seemed to us like a five star plus hotel - and we know this because my husband was a chef at Hillton. At saturday night there was a pleasent atmosphere in the dining room, a saturday's night's serenity. The food was excellent and varied. There were more than 6 meat dishes and of-course many salads and many side-dishes.
